item.title: Sajid Javid apologises for 'cower' Covid remark
item.description: The health secretary says he used a poor choice of word in a tweet, after criticism from victims' group.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Chelsie Giles wins GB's first medal, Bradly Sinden guarantees at least silver
item.description: Day two of the Tokyo 2020 Olympics is under way, and Team GB's first medal has been won.

item.title: Man, woman and boy die in Loch Lomond incident
item.description: Police say they died at the scene near Ardlui after getting into difficulty in the water.

item.title: UK will be paying for Covid for decades, say MPs
item.description: They also criticised the government's spending on unusable protective kit and called for an urgent inquiry.

item.title: Female military staff denied justice by inadequate system - MPs
item.description: Veterans describe a "boys' club" where sex assaults were hushed up and complaining could be career-ending.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Rowing races postponed due to weather and tennis heat policy activated
item.description: Tokyo 2020 Olympics organisers have cancelled two days of rowing with adverse weather conditions expected to hit Japan's capital.

item.title: Afghanistan curfew imposed as Taliban militants advance
item.description: The government says the measure is to help its forces stop Taliban militants infiltrating cities.

item.title: Carrickfergus: Funfair incident caused by teens, Planet Fun says
item.description: Planet Fun says injuries were caused in County Antrim on Saturday because of "misuse of equipment".

item.title: Clashes in Paris over Covid measures
item.description: French anti-riot police fired tear gas during protests against Covid-19 curbs and vaccination.

item.title: Hundred organisers say online 'racism or other forms of abuse' unacceptable
item.description: Organisers of The Hundred say they do not "accept racism or other forms of abuse" following "recent online comments directed towards players and fans".

item.title: Football manager Joey Barton charged with attacking woman
item.description: The former Premier League player is charged by police after an incident in London.

item.title: Climate change: Hebden Bridge boy, 11, starts 200 mile walk
item.description: Jude will walk 10 miles each day for 21 days to reach Westminster, where he will lobby ministers.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The youngest athletes, past and present
item.description: GB skateboarder Sky Brown is 13 years old, but there have been even younger in the history of the Games.

item.title: From lockdown animations to Snoop Dogg music video
item.description: After his homemade animations went viral, Snoop Dogg asked Peter Quinn to direct his new video.

item.title: Lightning strikes and storms follow UK heatwave
item.description: Days of high summer temperatures give way to storms.

item.title: Goole WW2 bomb: Army experts carry out controlled explosion
item.description: A live Word War Two bomb, unearthed by builders on a housing development, has been destroyed in a controlled explosion.

item.title: The Papers: Double jab for football and PM's crime 'blitz'
item.description: A government plan for vaccine passports to attend football matches is among the front-page stories.

item.title: Unesco World Heritage: Wales' slate landscape bid for honour
item.description: Slate from north-west Wales "roofed the 19th Century world" as it was exported around the globe.

item.title: Budapest Pride stands up for LGBT rights in Hungary
item.description: Organisers accuse Hungary's right-wing government of seeking to discriminate against gay people.

item.title: The battle for Indonesia's Gold Island
item.description: There are fears that a mine will threaten Sangihe island's ancient forests and local water supply.

item.title: Cars towed for 'dangerous' parking in Snowdonia
item.description: Authorities are trying to avoid a repeat of summer 2020, when hundreds of cars obstructed roads.

item.title: The young imam using Instagram to change opinions
item.description: Sabah Ahmedi wants to show imams can "have a laugh", have "a bit of banter" and "wear colourful socks".

item.title: 'You'd walk out if your husband hit you - you can't when it's your child'
item.description: Parenting a violent child is a traumatic experience, and one that is often hidden from view.

item.title: The experiences replacing closed High Street stores
item.description: Go-karts, bowling alleys and eateries have taken the place of closed retailers on the High Street.

item.title: The YouTubers who blew the whistle on an anti-vax plot
item.description: A mysterious marketing agency secretly offered to pay social media stars to spread disinformation about Covid-19 vaccines

item.title: Excitement over wooden shipwreck found in Antigua's seabed
item.description: Historians believe the wreck found in Antigua to be the 1762 Beaumont, a French merchant ship.

item.title: Great Yarmouth: 'This town got stuck in time but now I'm loving it'
item.description: Great Yarmouth is turning its fortunes round with an increase in visitors and several big projects.

item.title: Covid vaccines: Why a giant plastic bag shortage is slowing the rollout
item.description: A look at the critical vaccine components in short supply, as a new global marketplace is launched to tackle bottlenecks.

item.title: Covid: The holiday makers having to self-isolate abroad
item.description: Some holidaymakers who tested positive for Covid while abroad are having to stay and self-isolate.

item.title: Latitude festival: Magical, emotional... and a little bit frightening
item.description: Bands and fans describe the atmosphere at the UK's first full-capacity festival since 2019.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: What's stopping aid getting in?
item.description: A renewed surge in fighting has made it ever more difficult for aid to reach areas in desperate need.

item.title: Sinden going for Team GB's first Tokyo gold at 13:45 BST in taekwondo
item.description: Bradly Sinden guarantees Great Britain's second medal of the Tokyo Olympics by reaching the men's -68kg taekwondo final.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Judoka Chelsie Giles wins Team GB's first medal at Tokyo 2020
item.description: Chelsie Giles becomes Great Britain's first medallist of the Tokyo Olympics, winning bronze after defeating Switzerland's Fabienne Kocher in the women's -52kg judo competition.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'I put too much pressure on myself' - Jade Jones on shock taekwondo exit
item.description: Two-time Olympic taekwondo champion Jade Jones discusses her shock defeat to Kimia Alizadeh of the Refugee Olympic Team in the first round of the women's -57kg tournament.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'Not the usual Biles' - US star struggles to find form in qualifying
item.description: Watch highlights as Simone Biles is far from perfect as the USA finish second behind the Russian Olympic Committee in gymnastics qualifying.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Chelsie Giles wins Team GB's first medal with judo bronze
item.description: Judoka Chelsie Giles wins Team GB's first medal of the Tokyo Olympics with bronze in the women's -52kg event.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Anna Kiesenhofer wins shock road race gold with GB's Lizzie Deignan 11th
item.description: Austria's Anna Kiesenhofer launches a remarkable solo breakaway to win road race gold on her Olympic debut, as Britain's Lizzie Deignan finishes 11th.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Yuto Horigome wins first ever Olympic skateboarding gold
item.description: Watch as 22-year-old Yuto Horigome of Japan makes history by becoming the first Olympic skateboarding gold medallist.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Australia set world record in women's 4x100m freestyle relay
item.description: Watch as the Australian women's 4x100 freestyle relay team set a new world record to win gold on day two of the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tunisia's Ahmed Hafnaoui wins gold, surfing and skateboarding debut & Jade Jones beaten
item.description: Watch key moments from the early events of day two at the Tokyo Olympics including a swimming shock, new sports taking centre stage and heartbreak for Jade Jones.

item.title: Two-time champion Jones loses in Olympics first round
item.description: Watch the final moments as two-time champion Jade Jones loses in her first match at the Tokyo Olympics to Kimia Alizadeh of the Refugee Olympic Team.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: I beat an Olympian... when I was younger
item.description: Radio 1 Newsbeat speaks to people who can boast they once beat some of the current Team GB.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Top 10 days for Team GB at the Olympics
item.description: BBC Sport selects the top 10 unmissable days for Team GB fans at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics medals table
item.description: Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: GB's defending champion Whitlock set to make pommel final
item.description: Great Britain's defending champion Max Whitlock reaches the pommel horse final at the Tokyo Olympics with a score of 14.900.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: First gold of Games goes to China's Yang Qian in shooting
item.description: Chinese shooter Yang Qian wins the first gold of the Olympics but has to sing her anthem behind a mask and hang her own medal round her neck.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: BBC TV schedule, radio and online coverage - times and channels
item.description: Full listings and coverage channels for the Tokyo Olympics across BBC TV, BBC iPlayer, BBC radio and online.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Table tennis 12-year-old Hend Zaza, gymnast Zou Jingyuan and 3x3 basketball - best moments
item.description: Watch some of the best moments from the opening events of the Tokyo Olympics including a 12-year-old table tennis player and debut of 3x3 basketball.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Syria's Hend Zaza, 12, is out, but hopes to inspire others
item.description: Youngest Olympian Hend Zaza, the 12-year-old Syrian table tennis star, wants to inspire others despite losing 4-0 in the preliminary round.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: How well do you know Olympic sports lingo?
item.description: Ever heard of a guppy hold? Know which sport would see a pancake used? Test how good your knowledge of Olympic lingo is.

item.title: Polly Swann: Olympic rower on working the wards, training in her shed & unfinished business
item.description: BBC Scotland speaks to Olympic rower Polly Swann on juggling training for Tokyo with working in a surgical ward in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Watch best opening ceremony moments in two minutes
item.description: Watch all the best bits from the Tokyo 2020 opening ceremony - including the best of the athletes' entrances and the lighting of the iconic Olympic flame by Naomi Osaka.

item.title: Team GB athletics - who are the medal hopes?
item.description: Who are Great Britain's big hopes and long shots to get on the podium in Tokyo? London 2012 Olympian and former world silver medallist Hannah England gives her view...

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Fully jabbed adults don't have to self-isolate after visiting amber-list countries - except France.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: The contact tracing app could be changed to make it less sensitive, so it sends fewer alerts.

item.title: Care homes worst hit by Covid – search the data
item.description: Figures from Care Quality Commission lay out the pandemic's 'devastating impact' on care homes in England.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-18s can now get the Covid jab, but the government has criticised take-up among young people.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and how will Covid affect them?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics have begun, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as more than 46 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate, which workers are exempt and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: A small number of named employees in key sectors will be exempt from some rules

item.title: Covid symptoms: Is it a cold or coronavirus?
item.description: With similar symptoms, deciding whether or not you need to get tested for coronavirus can be tricky.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid rules from 19 July: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Vaccine experts recommend that a limited group of children should be offered Covid jabs ahead of winter.

item.title: 'Covid passports': How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England will have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.
